primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus enters a world of 'meanness' and 'rancid death' to provide abundant life and ontological identity to those trapped in externalism and fear.

tekstueel_bewijs: I am come that they might have life
He went down that we might come up
He stood up, declared that all power is given unto him
that they might have it more abundantly
life has a meaning that we believe it was intended to have
Jesus taught us that we are somebody

zender.identificatie: The Divine Will / The Spirit of Life
tekstueel_bewijs: life has a meaning that we believe it was intended to have
My words... they are spirit and they are life
The church of the Redeemer ought to be interested in people's lives, healing and helping
The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill
The grand heresy of Western civilization was that life can be lived from the outward inwardly
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'thief' that destroys and the ontological power of death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's journey of perseverance on the 'right road' despite darkness.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (In Christ)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The believer's movement is predicated entirely on being 'in Christ' (the primary program).

voorbeelden_god_subject: I am come that they might have life
He died for a moment that we might live forever
He stood up, declared that all power is given unto him
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We confuse modern machinery with human fulfillment
We accepted the premise in this country
If you are in Jesus Christ, you on the right road

voorbeelden: Someday we're going to learn that
wanting to come to see fulfillment
If we had heard truly the words of Jesus, we'd have understood
I am come that they might have life
all power is given unto him

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on Christ's power to grant life (Pouvoir) rather than the hearer's obligation (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'meanness' of the world (~S1) to the 'rancid death' (S2), resolved by Christ's resurrection (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies the space of S2 (death) to negate it, moving the receiver to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is described as 'rancid' and the thief as a destroyer.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. Christ is the primary actant who achieves the object (life) for the receiver. Human action is framed as 'being on the road' provided by Christ.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on internal heart-work as a prerequisite
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Out of the heart... are the issues of life.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Christ as the sole source of life
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I am the resurrection and the life.
He went down that we might come up.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples but as witnesses to Christ's power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sister is a receiver of the Word, not a model of behavior.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Assurance and relief; moving from 'riffraff' to 'heir'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the social critique (the thief) to the Christological solution is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'living from the inside out' (which sounds like human effort) and 'Christ as life' (which is gift).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: held captivity captive... all power is given unto him

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'life' that constitutes the new competence of the subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is a 'thief' that kills and destroys, not just a mistake.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the Subject of the primary soteriological verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'thief' and 'rancid death' are sufficiently heavy opponents.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's coming) correctly grounds the Ethics (the life community).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of a theocentric sermon that addresses social meanness without lapsing into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'locks on the door' metaphor; semiotics focuses on how those locks function as an Opponent to the Subject's freedom.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain John 10:10; semiotics shows how the preacher 'casts' the hearer as the Receiver of Christ's 'Pouvoir'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'inside-out' language, which could be moralistic, is actually a description of the Object (Life) being transferred from Sender to Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'we' frequently in the middle section to describe the human condition, but switches to Christ as Subject for the resolution.
